title: Kordarell Williams arrested for hitting boy, 7, in video | NT News
text:
Sickening CCTV footage emerges showing boy being hit 62 times with a belt news.com.au February 20, 2017 12:11pm 
HORRIFIC footage shows the moment a man allegedly lashed his girlfriend’s seven-year-old son with a belt 62 times for “stealing a phone charger”. 
Kordarell Williams, 27, has been charged with child abuse after police saw the footage of the brutal beating on a Houston street. 
Police said the man took the child out of the car at an illegal dumping site at 5pm on Thursday before “beating him senselessly”. media_camera Kordarell Williams took the boy to an illegal dumping ground. He was unaware that CCTV cameras were installed in the area to catch people dumping their rubbish. 
Video footage allegedly shows Williams striking the boy with the belt on his head, shoulders and legs more than 62 times in five minutes. 
He also allegedly knocked the boy to the ground and put him in a headlock, according to police. 
“He struck this child 62 times, put him in a headlock and knocked him over on numerous occasions with the blows,” said Constable Alan Rosen, according to Click2houston.com . 
The boy suffered bruising to his eyes and neck as well as cuts on his chest, legs and behind, prosecutors said. media_camera Kordarell Williams, 27, has been arrested for child abuse after graphic footage of him beating a seven-year-old child outside his car was reported to police. Picture: Houston Police 
“This is just hard for me to describe. The brutalness of how he beat this child,” Constable Rosen said. 
Detectives said Williams is the boyfriend of the boy’s mother. 
He was tracked down by police and arrested three hours after the alleged attack using the numberplates seen on the footage in the Texas city. 
Williams reportedly admitted to investigators he hit the boy 16 times for stealing a phone charger. 
Police were also told that Williams had beat the boy in the past. 
Williams is now behind bars on a $US30,000 ($40,000) bond.
